clinical_study.brief_title: Implementing Shared Decision Making in Interprofessional Home Care Teams
clinical_study.official_title: Implementing Shared Decision Making in Interprofessional Home Care Teams : a Stepped Wedge Cluster Randomized Trial

primary_outcome.description: To assess the proportion of caregivers reporting an active role, a modified version of the Control Preferences Scale designed to assess the role assumed in the decision making process will be used. The scale consists of a single question and is the one most frequently used in studies assessing the implementation of SDM in clinical practice.

secondary_outcome.description: Assessed with the Dyadic-OPTION scale, a 12-item self-administered instrument that assesses 12 specific SDM behaviours during the decision-making process
Assessed with the Decisional Regret Scale
Assessed with the Decisional Conflict Scale
Assessed with two subscales (Social isolation and Emotional reactions) of the HR-QoL questionnaire from the Nottingham Health Profile, clients only
Assessed with the Zarit Burden Inventory Scale (ZBI), caregivers only

secondary_outcome.measure: Preferred and chosen option (remain at home or move to another location)
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire assessing the prefered and chosen option

arm_group.description: IP-SDM training for health professionals (intervention at 4 months)
IP-SDM training for health professionals (intervention at 11 months)
IP-SDM training for health professionals (intervention at 18 months)
IP-SDM training for health professionals (intervention at 25 months)

intervention.description: Multifaceted SDM training program for providers: i) 1.5-hour online tutorial, ii) 3.5-hour skills building workshop; iii) video-clip demonstrating SDM in the context of an IP home care team with an aging adult making a decision about location of care (to be used with clients and providers as well); and iv) performance feedback to providers (role play during the workshop).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Clients or caregivers of clients :
- Aged ≥65 years;
- Receiving care from the IP home care team of the enrolled CISSS/CIUSSS
- Have made a decision about whether to stay at home or move to another location during the recruitment periods
- Are able to read, understand and write French or English
- Can give informed consent
In the case clients are not able to provide informed consent, their caregiver will be eligible.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clients who are not able to provide informed consent and who don't have a caregiver
